programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Emma gets a surprise visit from her creepy foster brother, Travis (KENNETH MILLER), and Sutton is thrown into Emma's old life in Las Vegas.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Emma searches to finally get some answers in the Mercer household, while Sutton tries to pull off her best Emma imitation.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: On their 17th birthday, Emma's ideal life is about to come to an end as a vengeful Sutton makes her way back to Phoenix to get her life back.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: It's been a tough night for Emma and Ethan, and things get tougher when they find Sutton has disappeared after their argument. Char's aunt (CHARISMA CARPENTER) returns to town.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: As an anonymous threat hangs over her head, Emma takes an opportunity to leave town and visit her dad's alma mater. Rebecca (CHARISMA CARPENTER) tries to help Char.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: As Emma, Ethan and Thayer (CHRISTIAN ALEXANDER) seek the truth of what happened to Sutton at the lake, they follow a lead that raises more questions than it answers.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Emma and Ethan's loyalty to each other is strong, but the lies start to take their toll. Laurel and Ted are shocked to discover the motive behind Justin's (RANDY WAYNE) actions.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Trying to help Emma, Ethan heads into a situation that gets out of control. Mads sneaks off to see Ryan (MISHA CROSBY), and Laurel continues to see Justin (RANDY WAYNE).

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: When Ethan's implicated in a serious crime, he and Sutton hide out with his father, Ben Whitehorse (GIL BIRMINGHAM - The Twilight Saga), on the reservation where he grew up.

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Determined to prove Ethan's innocence, Emma takes matters into her own hands, with the help of Mads and Thayer (CHRISTIAN ALEXANDER).

programme.title: The Lying Game

programme.title: The Lying Game
programme.desc: Thayer (CHRISTIAN ALEXANDER) starts to doubt Alec's (ADRIAN PASDAR) alibi and begins investigating Rebecca's (CHARISMA CARPENTER) past. Meanwhile, Ethan is avoiding Emma.

programme.title: The Lying Game

programme.title: The Lying Game

programme.title: The Lying Game

Discover the immigrant stories, bustling markets, and beloved eateries that make this iconic street a true cultural and culinary treasure.

programme.title: Revealed
programme.desc: Explore the tumultuous construction of the Brooklyn Bridge, the Roebling family's innovative engineering and the extraordinary perseverance behind the project. programme.title: Crime Files

programme.title: Crime Files

programme.title: Crime Files

programme.title: Crime Files

programme.title: Revealed

programme.title: Revealed

programme.title: Revealed

programme.desc: Where can you find a book about choosing weird, a torch-wielding craftswoman, and a family bakery burning the midnight oil? The same place where alleyways have meaningful names and the American River changed the course of triathlons.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: From sky high treetop adventures to bewitching rituals, Maddy and Dixie conquer their fears and get out of their comfort zones.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Dare to try a chicken sandwich so spicy even the chef won't eat it. Cool off with a sweet treat at a historic corner ice cream shop. Enjoy monumental views from the Potomac River, and create your own Harry Potter potion.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Nick packed up his family and moved to Savannah to be closer to nature. But since the move, he hasn’t been able to disconnect from work. Kinga takes him away from his desk to explore what the great state of Georgia has to offer.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Chefs Jessica Peconi and Dee Dixon are getting saucy in today’s cooking challenge. Can the chefs craft the most savory dips, dressings, or relish? Or will they get Lost in the Sauce?

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie seek out Sacramento locals who are trend setting and pushing the limits in the original & inventive ways they do business.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Three-year-old Kamille McKinney, affectionately known as "Cupcake," is abducted while playing outside a relative's Birmingham home. The ensuing search unifies the city, as residents pray she will be found alive.

programme.title: Ethan: The Miracle Dog
programme.desc: Follow one dog's journey to recovery, a forever home and eventually, stardom.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Take a trip to see some unique destinations across the country.

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: Shift: The Ragbrai Documentary
programme.desc: A celebration of the oldest, largest, and longest recreational touring bicycle ride in the world. Three riders and a pair of community leaders reach new personal heights, changing their lives along the seven day ride across Iowa.

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept “Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.”

programme.title: Easy Money: Fraud, Fortune and Failures
programme.desc: (2021) With nearly 15 hours of interviews from 17 people – and dozens of hours of news footage — Easy Money tells the story of what is being called the worst fraud in California history.

programme.title: Always Remember Your Name
programme.desc: A documentary of mistaken identity, hope, love, and the power of story by two Holocaust survivors.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a 300-year-old violin valued at $6 million, to thousands of rare books, thieves will go to wild, even dangerous, lengths to snatch up irreplaceable treasures. For investigators, it's a race against the clock to recover these priceless valuables.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Sometimes, would-be criminals are their own worst enemies. This episode highlights crime “fails,” and the officers - and ordinary civilians - who save the day.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Glenda Macatangay has conquered her career and being a single mom to four kids. But when it comes to being comfortable in the outdoors, she isn’t as confident. Kinga meets up with Glenda in Sacramento, CA to introduce her to the wonders of the wilderness.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Karla, a devoted mother and doting grandmother has had her fair share of obstacles from two bouts of cancer to caring for her husband and daughter. Karla embarks on a much needed day of pampering, seeking solace and self-care.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact meets two female scientists whose work in women’s health research is being threatened by funding cuts. Plus, chef and restaurateur Alice Waters shares her passion for fresh, locally sourced food. And, a North Dakota woman works to preserve her tribe’s traditional farming methods.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin and Ryan fly 3,000 miles to visit the “Mouth Ninja," a paralyzed artist who makes incredible drawings using only his mouth. Jimmy Luv and Davin lead the band in an epic ghost hunting adventure inside a haunted building.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: What strange snack did a woman eat at a football game? What ice cream flavor was inspired by a hot dog topping? Frank Nicotero is asking these questions and more, as Cincinnati locals try to win cash prizes.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nation’s largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand… or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, America’s native spirit.

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nation’s largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand… or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, America’s native spirit.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A beloved University of Kentucky football player is murdered on the porch of his house during his 21st birthday party in an assassination-style killing. What leads to the shooter's capture is equally shocking.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Free Spirit

programme.desc: Soar new heights with Kenny, a single musician who is ready for his three blind dates. What amazing woman will prevail? Will romance be in the air with Domonique, will love roll into his heart with Ashlee, or will he find treasure with Kara?

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Old classics get a fun twist. Amanda hits the town with expert mixologist Kate Gerwin, who introduces her to a custom sneaker shop, a new pizza place with some unexpected ingredients, and the city’s unique lowrider scene.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob feasts on fabulous cuisine, makes more than a few new friends and joins a trampoline gym class in one of Boston's oldest neighborhoods.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Heists that are so bold, brazen and audacious you have to see them to believe them. But in the world of crime, audacity doesn’t always pay.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From stealing an ambulance after leaving a hospital to hijacking a helicopter for the sake of love, these criminals have odd motives and even odder methods of executing them.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed & Day reconnect with their youth, work on their flexibility in an artistic way, and explore local beer culture at Allegheny City Brewing in the Northside.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: The charming town of Florence, South Carolina is booming. Explore the revitalized downtown, try your best to solve an escape room, and grab a bite at a local food truck. You can also stay the night on a farm and wake up to your own private petting zoo!

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Jessie Fiacco is a single mother and nurse, who during the pandemic made home visits. But Jessie hasn’t made time for herself. Luckily for her, Kinga is in town to show Jessie she doesn’t have to travel far to get far out.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: Local Kansas City notables Chef Shanita, Don Daughtry Sr., and the owners of Duet share where to go for cinnamon whiskey, an immersive historical experience, yoga with plants in paradise and more!

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: It’s a culinary battle of the senses between two iconic chefs in the City Beautiful. Watch as Chef Liz of Garp & Fuss in Winter Park takes on Chef Trina of Se7en Bites in The Milk District. It’s The Knife versus The Whisk!

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept “Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.”

programme.title: Escaping The Blade
programme.desc: Why California's sex traffickers are walking free while victims wait in fear and how organizations are fighting to protect survivors.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Glenda Macatangay has conquered her career and being a single mom to four kids. But when it comes to being comfortable in the outdoors, she isn’t as confident. Kinga meets up with Glenda in Sacramento, CA to introduce her to the wonders of the wilderness.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: A classic mountain showdown has this hopping ski town divided. But everyone agrees that no matter which mountain reigns supreme, this four-season hot spot offers great food, bucolic retreats, and a whole new view on the great outdoors.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin and Ryan drum up joy at Hope Lodge, delighting the dedicated staff and energizing patients. In Greenville, locals try for cash during a basketball challenge. A resourceful couple's resilience is rewarded.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Long time chef friends Kisha Washington and Brian Hohl compete in this Smaltimore small plates challenge. Can these small town friends handle a big screen competition?

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Sommer is a lawyer who’s been struggling to find a suitable mate in Kansas City. Three lucky singles will try their luck as they take her to the driving range, yoga and meditation at a studio and on a whiskey distillery tour at J. Rieger & Co.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: From meditating in a salt cave to braving a cold plunge, Rob treats his mind, body and soul to a variety of holistic therapies.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Follow Maddy & Dixie as they go on a historical tour around iconic Sacramento locales. Learn how the city was raised during floods. And check out the famous banana cream pie at Frank Fats.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact meets two female scientists whose work in women’s health research is being threatened by funding cuts. Plus, chef and restaurateur Alice Waters shares her passion for fresh, locally sourced food. And, a North Dakota woman works to preserve her tribe’s traditional farming methods.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Drink a local beer as you browse antiques and oddities. Donate to a good cause by sticking a dollar bill in the ceiling at a popular tavern, and get your recommended eight to fourteen hours of sleep in a vintage camper.

programme.title: Refugees Welcome: A Story of Immigration to America’s Heartland
programme.desc: Refugees Welcome documents how one Governor’s brave decision to welcome refugees during the Vietnam War had far reaching repercussions not only for the country but, generations later, for the fate of his own family.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Three brutal cold cases remain unsolved for decades until advances in forensic technology bring investigators closer than ever to finding answers for the victims’ families and friends.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: Farm to table is easy when you own the farm! Sun Belly Cafe, Oak Hill Farm & Cafe, Farm Fresh Fast, and The Anchorage Restaurant invite us into their kitchens and show us how farming and sustainability influence their menus.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Drink some ‘shockingly’ good brew. Ride shotgun in a motorcycle sidecar as you tour the local wine country. Share a life-size mimosa with a friend and fall asleep on a working farm where you can literally count sheep.

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Join Esquire’s Dave Holmes as he chats with award-winning musician, Dermot Kennedy, and toasts all things Cincinnati.

programme.title: Bourbon Blaze: The Night That Tested America's Spirit
programme.desc: When a massive fire hits one of the nation’s largest bourbon distilleries, the families of competing bourbon companies have to decide whether to lend a hand… or let it burn. This is the story of bourbon, America’s native spirit.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: From a football star equally comfortable at the rodeo, to a wrestler who created a custom mask to compete after a serious injury, these OKC athletes play sports on their own terms.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Willington may be young, but this activist knows exactly what he’s looking for. Will it be fashionista Guerds, fellow actor Georgerinna, or doctor-to-be Pheddy?

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: On two feet or four wheels, Amanda is on the move with soccer superstar Devon Sandoval. Together they compete head-to-head with high powered RC cars, build a board with an expert skater, and join in the wild fandom of New Mexico’s beloved team.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Sink your teeth into the Midwest's sweets. From the messy madness of puppy chow to kolaches to the infamous buckeye, enjoy the delicious confections that make the region a haven for dessert lovers.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Whether it’s gathering thousands of mysterious, colorful packets stuffed in a store’s ceiling or valuable wildlife slithering to freedom, investigators must be ready to decisively face a range of mammoth tasks in the field.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Thrilling racing action, a treetop dinner, ice cream heaven and a caving adventure.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin, Ryan and Tony introduce us to a real-life superhero who has opened her home and heart to special needs children.

programme.title: Grit of Greenwood
programme.desc: Greenwood was a thriving Black district in Tulsa when, 100 years ago, it was destroyed in less than 24 hours.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda Machon meets with a different guest each episode who will show off their favorite spots in Albuquerque and the best way to experience this one-of-a-kind city. This series is all about discovering everything that makes ABQ unique and exciting.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Embark on amazing adventures across America with host Kinga Philipps who takes locals out of their comfort zones to experience transformation in the great outdoors.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.desc: 84% of women have been harassed while running. Not Today, by Runner's World, examines this through the stories of three runners. Mollie Tibbetts and Wendy Martinez were both brutally murdered, while Kelly Herron fought off her attacker and survived.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Host and comedic actor Amy Brassette McKeon challenges two sets of couples to pass a good time on a dime in their city. Find out which couple will experience the most amazing date for under fifty bucks.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: No one knows a city like the locals who live there. This series taps into the insider knowledge of notable figures including musicians, athletes, chefs, artists, influencers, and others who share their best spots to hit up in the city.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Local radio personality, Greg Adams, wants to shine a light on all parts of his beloved city and prove that Milwaukee has a lot more to offer than people might expect. In each episode, Greg is joined by a notable personality from the community who shows him their favorite spots and the best ways to experience them.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: From professional hockey players to award-winning muralists, The Spark highlights the craft, the journey, and the joy. These masters and thought leaders may have made names for themselves on the national stage, but they never forget the city that sparks their inspiration daily

programme.title: Weathering the Storm
programme.desc: On December 10, 2021, a violent tornado outbreak hit western Kentucky. It was the deadliest weather event in the history of the Commonwealth. But as families faced a bleak holiday season, hope emerged in surprising ways.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: One evening in 1999, Cythnia Jaramillo shows up at a home wearing nothing but a dog collar. She had been tortured and sexually assaulted for days. Her escape leads investigators to discover a gruesome string of kidnappings and murders.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Orlando expert, Brendan O'Connor, celebrates the people behind the scenes of the businesses that make Orlando a truly unique place. Join him as he rolls up his sleeves and receives hands on training while spending a day with them, On The Job.

programme.title: The Jigsaw Man
programme.desc: Terror strikes London, England as severed body parts start showing up at random locations across the countryside. Police must piece together the human jigsaw puzzle in order to track down the perpetrator, a common thug who's mastered the dark art of body dismemberment.

programme.title: Fit To Kill
programme.desc: A beautiful brunette is killed and left inside a burned out luxury car in the high desert. At first, it seems as though the perpetrators have gotten away with murder. As cops investigate the brutal homicide, they find a trail of missteps, which they trace back to two muscle-bound, married murderers.

programme.title: Redneck Retribution
programme.desc: A scorned mistress exacts the ultimate revenge, hiring a group of derelicts to kill the wife of her lover. When the heat comes, she plays the victim and denies any involvement, but no level of acting will allow her to escape the cold truth, the murder was caught on camera.
